alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 08 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...High Water Levels Remain on Lincoln County Rivers and Streams... Warmer temperatures through Wednesday will allow for continued snowmelt, but it will not be warm enough to generate a large amount of runoff. However, rivers and streams are expected to continue running high through Wednesday. The best chance for up to one-quarter inch of rain will be Wednesday afternoon in association with scattered showers and thunderstorms. Local emergency management continues to report widespread low-land flooding near the Bear River, with smaller tributary streams running high as well. Currently, flooding is mainly affecting low-lying agricultural areas. Water levels on creeks, streams, and rivers will remain relatively steady before warmer temperatures the week of May 15, provide the possibility of further rises due to melting snow. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Hilly terrain and backcountry roads in the foothills can be affected by increased stream flows due to snowmelt. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
